text.title: Stop Your Child from Lying (Homework Related)

p.s: Many children lie to their parents about completing their homework .
When your children lie to you , they may break your trust in them .
In order to give them your trust back , a series of steps must be followed in order to prevent your child from lying about their homework in the future .

item.s: Find out why your children lie about their homework .
Take time to listen to their feelings without being overly negative about them lying .
Just let them talk .
They may actually have a good reason that you have n't listened to before .
Explain to them that lying is not acceptable .
Tell them that it is okay they did n't finish , but remind them that instead of lying , they should ask for help .
Help them if they are having trouble .
Talk your way through the concept , work a problem with them , and ask questions to make sure they are comprehending .
Be supportive of your children .
If they are having trouble , help them as much as you can and be understanding if they do n't make as good grades as they could .
Instead . encourage them to do better and focus on their strengths .
Ask your child to bring you their homework for you to check .
This is the best way to resolve the problem .
When they bring you homework , you can see if they 've finished or not and whether they have been lying to you .
Give them a time when they should be done with their homework .
At the set time , you will check their homework .
Remind them they can ask for help at any time .

figure.rend: Excuse Yourself from Unfinished Homework Step 7 Version 6.jpg

item.s: Be ready to punish lying if this continues to happen .
Take away a favorite toy or electronic if they lie again .

figure.rend: Make Up a Good Excuse for Your Homework Not Being Finished Step 1.jpg

item.s: Talk with your child 's teacher .
Many schools have a great way of allowing parent connection with the teacher .
The teacher may send e-mails regarding your child 's troubles with homework .
Then you can try to find a time to meet up with their teacher to address the issue .
You can also arrange with your child 's teacher a tutoring schedule or having an aide come to the house to tutor your child .

figure.rend: Talk to Parents When You Babysit Their Kids Step 3 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Try turning off the television in the living room to help your child focus on homework .
If you still want to watch television , maybe you can go to your bedroom instead .
Confiscate your children 's electronics until their homework is complete .
This ensures they are not wasting time while they should be doing their homework
Ask your child to do their homework in a common area ( such as the kitchen or living room ) so you can monitor them while they complete their homework .
Show genuine care and interest in your child 's life .
Do n't be too hard on the punishment , as your child may get discouraged and not try at all to improve .
